title: Three-Bean Salad with Tahini-Lime Dressing
directions: Cook beans, edamame, and corn in a large pot of boiling water 2 to 3 minutes or until beans are crisp-tender. Drain; transfer to a bowl of ice water. Let cool; drain and pat dry. Transfer to a serving bowl. Add garbanzo beans and cilantro; toss.

For dressing: In a small bowl whisk together tahini, lime juice, olive oil, salt, and cumin. If needed, add water, one tablespoon at a time, to reach desired consistency. Toss dressing with bean mixture. Season to taste with pepper. Chill, covered, up to 24 hours. Serves 8.

198 calories; 12 g total fat; 2 g saturated fat; 4 g polyunsaturated fat; 5 g monounsaturated fat; 0 mg cholesterol; 363 mg sodium. 383 mg potassium; 20 g carbohydrates; 5 g fiber; 5 g sugar; 8 g protein; 0 g trans fatty acid; 310 IU vitamin a; 12 mg vitamin c; 0 mg thiamin; 0 mg riboflavin; 2 mg niacin equivalents; 0 mg vitamin b6; 96 mcg folate; 0 mcg vitamin b12; 71 mg calcium; 2 mg iron;
ingredients: 16 ounces fresh green beans and/or yellow wax beans, trimmed
1 15 ounce can garbanzo beans, rinsed and drained
⅓ cup fresh lime juice (3 medium)
